isis.stitle: ALTERNATOR: LEECE NEVILLE AND PRESTOLITE JN SERIES - REASSEMBLE

step1.para: If slip ring end bearing has been removed, press a new bearing in place from the outside of the housing. Bearing should be installed with seal facing in toward slip rings. When properly installed, the manufacturer's part number stamped on the end of the bearing will be facing toward the outside of the housing.
Press new roller bearing in bearing bore to dimension shown in Figure 20.

Reinstall heat sinks in slip ring end housing. Be sure that upper and lower insulating washers are in their proper location. Install, but do not tighten, lower heat sink retaining screws, lockwashers, guard washers and insulating washers ( Figure 7). Replacement heat sinks may differ in thickness or appearance from the original assemblies, but will fit and function interchangeably.

note.para: Refer to Figure 21for installation of insulation bushings on 145 and 160 amp alternators.

step1.para: Install terminal bolts and regulator lead wires. Red wire goes on positive heat sink and black wire goes on negative. WHITE GOES TO THE CENTER STATOR CONNECTION. Be sure that mating surfaces of heat sinks, terminals and terminal bolts are clean and free of paint to insure a good electrical connection ( Figure 5).

Install two insulating bushings on each terminal bolt and install regulator housing. Be sure that red and black regulator leads are properly routed through cutaway section of end housing, and install and tighten nuts on terminal bolts ( Figure 22).

note.para: Newer alternators are internally grounded and do not use an insulator bushing in the NEGATIVE output terminal hole. The Slip Ring End housing in these units have a raised surface around the NEGATIVE output terminal hole ( Figure 23). Before assembly, apply a coat of electrical joint compound to the raised surface around the NEGATIVE output terminal hole.

figure.caption: Raised Surface Around Negative Output Terminal Hole

step1.para: Tighten lower heat sink screws and check all leads for proper routing, being sure that no lead is pinched under heat sink.

Install stator, slide a stator terminal on each of the three AC studs and secure with the 10-32 tenz nuts ( Figure 24). It is advisable to align the stator and housing by temporarily installing the through bolts.
Mask roller bearing with masking tape and paint all internal electrical connections with Westinghouse B-6-665 Red Air Dry Epoxy paint ( Figure 24).

Press drive end bearing into housing and reinstall bearing retainer and four screws. When installing bearing, press on outer race to avoid transmitting force through the bearing balls which could brinnel the bearing.
Press drive end housing and bearing onto rotor shaft. Using a sleeve around the shaft, press on the inner race to avoid brinnelling the bearing.
Install rotor and housing assembly into stator and slip ring end housing assembly, being sure that mounting lugs are aligned.

Install three through bolts and self locking nuts. Tighten to 50 to 60 in-lbs. (5.6 to 6.8 N•m). Place a small amount of grease (Chevron SRI 2 or equivalent) in housing and reinstall the metal dust cap by carefully pressing it into place.

Insert outer brush and spring assembly into housing and compress the brush spring with a small screwdriver or similar tool. While holding the spring compressed, insert a pin through the hole in the rear of the housing so that the spring will be held in a compressed position. (A suitable pin can be made from a piece of 1/16 inch [1.6mm ] drill rod.) Install and compress the remaining brush and spring assembly in a similar manner. Hold the spring in a compressed position by pushing the pin farther into the housing ( Figure 25).

Position regulator above regulator holder and install RED lead to regulator terminal marked R. Install the BLACK lead to regulator terminal marked B and attach. Attach the white lead to the W terminal ( Figure 26).
Be sure that the red, black and white leads are properly routed through their slots in the regulator housing. Withdraw brush retaining pin before clipping the regulator.

Install spacer, key, fan, pulley and nut. Tighten nut to 70 to 80 ft-lbs. (95 to 108 N•m). Due to the design of the alternator, a certain amount of shaft end play will be present in new or rebuilt units. This end play is designed into the unit and will vary between .004 and .012 inch (0.1 to 0.3mm).

caution.para: Do not force or pound pulley on shaft.
